channel.title: MYB
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from MYB, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Dumbing it down
item.description: There’s a lot of pressure to make things dumber. Better to make it dumb than to have someone simply walk away, apparently. With so much to consume, an...

item.title: GenAI Reality Bites Back For Software Developers
item.description: AI assistants are only the beginning of the genAI software development revolution.

item.title: 71% Of AI Workforce Is Men, Just 29% Are Women — How Do We Fix This?
item.description: Men have dominated the tech sector job arena by about a 2-to-1 margin for years. But the AI-skill gap is even wider. Experts weigh-in with thoughts an...

item.title: Clear ice
item.description: I love Zamboni machines. They’re ungainly, they’re slow but they’re also majestic. Like an elephant for ice hockey. After each period, when the ice is...

item.title: Is Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang The Next Steve Jobs?
item.description: Jensen Huang, the CEO of Nvidia, has the same caliber of vision and energy to drive his company to be like Apple, a multitrillion-dollar company.

item.title: Ice sculpture
item.description: There are very few activities that are fully reversible. Ice sculpture might be one of them. Once the ice melts, all the effort and information is los...

item.title: The Seductive Trap Of Predictive Analytics And What It Won’t Tell You
item.description: Forecasting tools promise a sneak peek into the future, allowing executives to make decisions based on what seems like near certainty.

item.title: “What should I do now?”
item.description: We’ve forgotten how often society had an answer for that question. Perhaps our shift away from a dictated answer not only gives us freedom, it also cr...

item.title: The Business Impact Of Black Friday, Cyber Monday, And The Holiday “Creep”
item.description: The Holiday season seems to start earlier each year. What can businesses do to get ready for Black Friday, Cyber Monday and the Holiday Creep?

item.title: Unforced errors
